Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) large pottery bowl (?); orange clay with white inclusions and silver mica; interior: streaky brown; exterior: part of a large boar to right and six-ray star-rosette; above, two lines, and in upper frieze paw of a feline to right and an uncertain motif; red paint on neck and on eyes of boar; incision used for details of boar and for outline of paw of upper frieze.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.276)
